rendering.interaction_matrix moduleÂ¶

helper class for interactive object motion

class rendering.interaction_matrix.InteractionMatrixÂ¶

Bases: object

Class holding a matrix representing a rigid transformation.

The current OpenGL is read into an internal variable and updated using rotations and translations given by user interaction.

add_rotation(ang, rot_x, rot_y, rot_z)Â¶

Concatenate the internal matrix with a translation matrix

add_translation(trans_x, trans_y, trans_z)Â¶

Concatenate the internal matrix with a translation matrix

get_current_matrix()Â¶

Get current transformation matrix resulting from interaction.

reset()Â¶

Initialise internal matrix with identity

rendering.mouse_interactor moduleÂ¶

class rendering.mouse_interactor.MouseInteractor(translation_scale=0.1, rotation_scale=0.2)Â¶

Bases: object

Connection between mouse motion and transformation matrix

apply_transformation()Â¶

Concatenation of the current translation and rotation matrices with the current OpenGL transformation matrix

mouse_button(button, mode, x_pos, y_pos)Â¶

Callback function for mouse button.

mouse_motion(x_pos, y_pos)Â¶

Callback function for mouse motion.

Depending on the button pressed, the displacement of the mouse pointer is either converted into a translation vector or a rotation matrix.
